contentrichtext.text: The word '''skip''' can refer to: == General usage == * [[Skip (container)]], a type of large open-topped container * [[Skip (music)]], a melodic interval * [[Skip (in audio playback)]], a type of malfunction of a phonograph or gramophone or CD player * [[Skip (radio)]], a radio signal which is reflected or refracted in the atmosphere or ionosphere * [[Skip (curling)]], a position in the sport of curling * [[Skip (gait)]], a style of gait movement involving a combination of walking and jumping * [[Jump rope]] (skipping rope), where one or more participants jump over a spinning rope so that it passes under their feet and over their heads * [[Skip-stop]], a public transit service pattern * A generational nickname: ''see'' [[Nickname#Nicknames_for_people]] * The Skip, a route run by the [[Regional Transportation District]] that runs between North and South Boulder, Colorado *''Skip'', the Norse word for [[ship]], generally denoting a large boat, but not necessarily a longship or ''langskip'' * Skip, a [[haircut]] style * Skip, [[Anglo-Celtic Australians]]; a word taken from the 1966 Australian children's television show ''Skippy the Bush Kangaroo'' * Skip, a detergent brand from [[List of Unilever brands|Unilever]] == Acronyms == * [[Simple Key-Management for Internet Protocol]] * [[Kodansha Kanji Learner's Dictionary|System of Kanji Indexing by Patterns]] == Names and titles == * [[Skips (snack)]] * [[Chris Candido]], also known as Skip * [[Skip Bifferty]], an English band * [[Skip Battin]] (1934–2003), musician, former bass player and songwriter with The Byrds * [[skip Ltd.]], a video game developer ===Fictional characters=== * [[Skip Ricter]], a character in the movie ''Cars'' * Skip, a demon from the TV series ''Angel''—see [[List of minor Angel characters#Skip]] * [[Skips (Regular Show)|Skips]], a character on ''[[Regular Show]]'' * [[Chip and Skips|Skips]], a twin brother of [[Chip and Skips|Chip]] on ''[[Camp Lazlo]]'' == Skipping == '''Skipping''' can refer to several things: * The hippity-hoppity [[gait (human)#Skip|gait]] that comes naturally to children * A game or form of exercise using a [[jump rope|skipping rope]] * [[Stone skipping]] * [[Snowmobile skipping]] * [[Skipping class]], otherwise known as ''truancy'' * British slang for [[Dumpster diving]] ==See also== * [[Skipper (disambiguation)]] {{disambig}}
